sections.label: Introduction
sections.content: Linear Search is a simple searching algorithm that checks each element one by one.

sections.label: Video Lecture
sections.content: Watch this video to understand Linear Search in depth.

sections.label: Algorithm
sections.content:
Step 1: Start from the first element.
Step 2: Compare each element with the target.
Step 3: If found, return index. Otherwise, return -1.

sections.label: Working
sections.content: Linear Search iterates through the list and compares each element with the target value.

sections.label: Code
sections.content: Here is the implementation of Linear Search in different languages.

sections.label: Analysis
sections.content: Time Complexity: O(n) in the worst case. Space Complexity: O(1).

sections.label: Introduction
sections.content: n queen is an efficient algorithm for finding an item in a sorted array.

sections.label: Video Lecture
sections.content: Watch this video to understand Binary Search in depth.

sections.label: Algorithm
sections.content:
Step 1: Find the middle element.
Step 2: If the middle element is the target, return index.
Step 3: If target is smaller, search in the left half; otherwise, search in the right half.

sections.label: Working
sections.content: Binary Search repeatedly divides the array in half to find the target.

sections.label: Code
sections.content: Here is the implementation of Binary Search in different languages.

sections.label: Analysis
sections.content: Time Complexity: O(log n) in the worst case. Space Complexity: O(1).
